resources.string: The Game of Life, also known simply as Life, is a cellular automaton devised by the British mathematician John Horton Conway in 1970. It is the best-known example of a cellular automaton.
Dynamic colorization theme of cells, based on number of adjacent neighbors.
Any live cell with fewer than the minimum number of live neighbors dies, as if by under-population
Any live cell with more than the maximum number of live neighbors dies, as if by overcrowding
Any dead cell with exactly the spawn number of live neighbors becomes a live cell
